tool.name: Methylation calling
tool.command:
calling --processors 4 -i $infile #if $infile.ext == "bam": --bam #end if
#if $cpg == 'true': --CpG $cpg_output #end if
#if $chh == 'true': --CHH $chh_output #end if
#if $chg == 'true': --CHG $chg_output #end if
#if $params.settingsType == "custom": $params.phred ## default 10 --mincov $params.mincov ## default 20 --minqual $params.minqual ## default 100 --readlen $params.readlen $params.methylkit $params.header #end if

param.name: settingsType
param.label: Meythylation calling - advanced settings
param.help: You can use the default settings or set custom values for any parameter.

param.name: phred
param.label: Run FastQC in the default mode on the FastQ file once trimming is complete

param.name: mincov
param.label: min coverage
param.help: For more information please see below.

param.name: minqual
param.label: min quality
param.help: For more information please see below.

param.name: methylkit
param.label: The generated output files are in methylkit format

param.name: header
param.label: Print header line in output files

tool.help:
**What it does**
Methylation calling of SAM or BAM files produced with bismark. BAM files can be processed in parallel and should be much faster.
